Fetch local area unemployment statistics (LAUS) data over time

Source: R/laus_trend.R
laus_trend.Rd

Fetch monthly LAUS data for a list of locations over a given time period. Requires a BLS API key; see blscrapeR::set_bls_key().

laus_trend(names, startyear, endyear, measures = "all", annual = FALSE,
  key = Sys.getenv("BLS_KEY"))

Arguments

names

A character vector of place names to look up: as of now, this is limited to Connecticut, and its counties and towns.
startyear

Numeric; first year of range
endyear

Numeric; last year of range
measures

A character vector of measures, containing any combination of "unemployment rate", "unemployment", "employment", or "labor force", or "all" (the default) as shorthand for all of the above.
annual

Logical: whether to include annual averages along with monthly data. Defaults FALSE.
key

A string giving the BLS API key. Defaults to the value in Sys.getenv("BLS_KEY"), as set by blscrapeR::set_bls_key.

Value

A data frame / tibble with columns for the measure, area, year, month number and name, value, series ID, and footnotes returned from the API.

Examples

laus_trend(c("New Haven", "Hamden"), 2014, 2017, annual = TRUE)
#> Error in is.response(x): Timeout was reached: Connection timed out after 10000 milliseconds
